pages.text: Tritylodon was a genus of tritylodontid cynodont therapsids that lived during the Early Jurassic (around 200 - 182.7 million years ago). Its name means "three-cusped tooth". The remains of this 30 cm (12 inch) long animal have been found at the Elliot Formation in South Africa, and at the Hanson Formation in Antarctica.

The anatomy of its shoulders, limbs and large front incisors indicated that it was a digger and most likely a burrower, while the rest of its teeth suggested that it was herbivorous (seemingly digging up and processing plants with the aforementioned incisors).
